alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 5:10AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Mecklenburg, southern Prince Edward, Lunenburg and Nottoway Counties through 600 AM EST... At 510 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Charlotte Court House to near Drakes Branch to near Staunton River State Park. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blackstone, Chase City, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, Hampden Sydney College, Nottoway, Lunenburg, Clarksville, Burkeville, Boydton, Kells Corner, Buffalo Springs, Rehoboth, Green Bay, Dundas, Rice, Bacons Fork, Wilburn and Arvins Store. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
